item.description:
Join international film buffs as well as Spanish language speakers and learners at Trinity College's free weekly showings of Iberian and Latin American films.

This week's film is Our Disappeared, directed by Juan Mandelbaum (Argentina, 2008)
After learning that Patricia, a long lost girlfriend from Argentina, is among the thousands who were kidnapped, tortured and then “disappeared” by the military during the 1976-1983 dictatorship, director Juan Mandelbaum embarks on a journey to find out what happened to her and others he knew who mysteriously vanished. As he revisits the dreams they shared for a revolution that would transform Argentina he also grieves the tragic losses and examines his own choices. Through dramatic stories told by parents, siblings, friends and children of the disappeared, Mandelbaum shows what happens when brutal regimes attack the fabric of a country with great impunity, causing enormous suffering that lasts for generations. http://www.mfa.org/ca...

Film starts at 7:00 in the Life Sciences Building.
For directions to Trinity, please visit http://www.trincoll.e...
Or call (860) 297-2053.

For campus map, see:
http://www.trincoll.e...

If you can come earlier than 6:45, please join us for supper in the Cave cafeteria (basement of Mather Hall, no id required). Prices are reasonable and the food is quite good. I usually get there by 5:15.
